page.lettertext:
fol.186r
Belgia. 1590 18 June To M
r
Bodly
By the Queene:
Elizabeth R
Trusty and welbelovid, we greete you well. Where of late we
sent our servant
Thomas Wilk
one of the Clark
of
o
r
Co
u
sel
,
into those part
, to treate w
t
the
Stat
g
n
rall
of the
united provinc
& w
t
the
Co
u
sel of State
about certain matters c
o
cerning o
r
service
& the weale of those Co
u
tryes, Wherin he is directid to use yo
r
advise as one long acqua
y
tid w
t
the State of those Coutryes, W
ch
though we doubt not but you will give to the best of yo
r
under-
standing, Yet we have thought good by these p
n
t
to autorise yo
u
to joyne w
t
o
r
said servant in all the actions c
o
mittid to his charge.
And so we will & require yo
u
to do, to the furderance of o
r
service
c
o
mytted to him by Instructions both from o
r
self, and from
o
r
certain of o
r
Counsell, Wherof upon the sight herof, we doubt
not but he will make yo
u
privie and willingly use yo
r
advise.
We can not but let you knowe o
r
gracious acceptau
n
of the care
wisdom, & diligence w
ch
we understand by o
r
Tresorer of England
you doo use in the charge c
o
myttid unto yo
u
there, for the furder
a
ce of o
r
service at all tymes. Wherof assume yo
r
self we will not be
unmyndfull to yo
r
comfort.
Given under o
r
Signett at o
r
Manno
r
of Grenwich the xviij
th
of
June. 1590,
in the xxxij
th
yeere of o
r
Raigne/
